extendedInfo.description: Donât miss the nationâs largest celebration of science and engineering at the 2012 USA Science & Engineering Festival hosted by Lockheed Martin. The Festival will be held April 28-29, 2012 at the Walter E. Washington Convention Center in Washington DC. This app navigates through 3,000 fun, hands-on, science and engineering activities, more than 100 stage shows, a career & job fair for high-school students, and the first USA Science & Engineering Festival Book Fair including 36 Featured Authors. Hours are 10am-6pm on Saturday, April 28, and 10am-4pm on Sunday, April 29, 2012 (doors open 9:30am for author presentations). The  event is free of charge and open to all ages. For more information visit www.usasciencefestival.org

reviews.title: Great app!
reviews.comment: Forced closed a couple times but now works great. Easy planning with the option to mark events and exhibits and save them under favorites.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Nice app
reviews.comment: Great app for the festival, but having a hard time finding where \"my schedule\" is located. Scroll from right to left to the second page to find it. App keeps saying that there is an update available each time I open it, but there never is.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Neat & Useful
reviews.comment: It\'s very convenient to have access to this app and not need to print out the map and schedules. Thank you!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good Info, But Over-Organized. Not Browsable.
reviews.comment: - \"My Schedule\" is the best part of the app. Would like the \"My Schedule\" feature to be front and center. Would be great if when I clicked in I could see all \"my\" events listed against an hourly calendar (not just a list of events) and their location so I could see what I plan to go to when and where on one page. - Too many screens to drill down to get to info. (i.e. Stage Shows/Mainstage/by date/April 29, 2012/list of shows). Please list all in chronological order (1 click off home) as default. Then give sort options across the top of the screen. - Would be nice if all home buttons on one screen (not two screens). Move scrolling tweets to their own page (and were not on the home).  - Nice if Tweets and other social media were all on one screen where I could interact with other event goers (with hashtag or social media activities). Tweets on home are too small and hard to navigate.  - Many (all?) links on the About page are PDFs. Boo. Great info. Hassle to navigate.  Thanks for the free app. Hope my user feedback is constructive. :)
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great Info, Buggy App Options
reviews.comment: The amount of information available through the app is amazing. I only wish the map was in color like the one on the website. I do have two other issues with the app, however, affecting my rating.  Every time I start the app it tells me a new version is available. When I click that I would like the newer version, it takes me to Google Play and tells me I already have the latest version.  When you start the app for the first time, it asks you if you want to receive push updates. Whether you select yes or no, there\'s no way to change this decision afterwards. I\'d like to be able to dynamically turn push updates on and off, but there isn\'t a way to do that.
reviews.author: A Google User
